intro: Alectra basserei, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. Alectra basserei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
